str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
